topic_list.topic: Detecting difference between voice and non-voice segments

general_query_list.answer: The meeting took place close to the finalization of the model, so participants were focused on further experimentation they could conduct. It began with a discussion about how the backend system could be further improved. The team thought that perhaps they could tweak language scaling and insertion penalties to see how the model changed its performance. Then, the team moved into discussing methods for detecting voice segments in their results. Finally, the team spent some time exploring normalization techniques and acoustic events, both of which could potentially improve model performance.

specific_query_list.query: Summarize the discussion on the tax return
specific_query_list.answer: Grad D was focused on filing his taxes. He explained to the team that he had both Canadian and US income, so he had to file taxes in both countries for the preceding year.

specific_query_list.query: What did Grad D think about the tax return?
specific_query_list.answer: Grad D thought that his tax returns were taking too much time. He had started writing code for his work, however. He was expecting that his taxes would be easier next year, since he would not have to declare his Canadian income.

specific_query_list.query: What did the professor think about the tax return?
specific_query_list.answer: The professor initially suggested that not making too much money made taxes easier. He learned that Canada wants taxes from Grad D. He also wanted to know if the same would hold for the coming year.

specific_query_list.query: Summarize the discussion about acoustic events
specific_query_list.answer: Grad A explained that he was trying to collect a set of acoustic events to help distinguish between various linguistic features. The team distinguished between acoustic features and acoustic events. Acoustic events were a feature of the acoustic signal that could be derived from the data.

specific_query_list.query: What did PhD F think about acoustic events?
specific_query_list.answer: PhD F explained the difference between acoustic features and acoustic events. Acoustic features are what linguists talk about whereas acoustic events are measurable properties of the acoustic signal, like its height.

specific_query_list.query: What did the professor think about acoustic events?
specific_query_list.answer: The professor recalled that the SPAM work had something similar to acoustic events, auditory events. He also informed the team that Professors Kollmeier and Professor Kleinschmidt will be visiting for six months, and they may know more about this topic.
